channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Wall Street Curbs Young Bankers' Hours After Overwork Outcry
item.description: JPMorgan adds 80-hour weekly cap and Bank of America revamps timekeeping after a Wall Street Journal investigation highlighted investment banking’s wo...

item.title: Norfolk Southern fires its CEO over relationship with another executive
item.description: Railroad operator Norfolk Southern Corp. fired Chief Executive Alan Shaw on Wednesday, following an investigation into allegations of misconduct.

item.title: U.S. Crude Oil Stockpiles Increase in Latest Week
item.description: U.S. crude oil inventories rose for the first time in four weeks, and gasoline and distillate stocks increased amid lower demand, according to EIA dat...

item.title: How to buy bitcoin, ether and other crypto ETFs with more security and less risk
item.description: Crypto ETFs are safer than owning cryptocurrencies outright — but you’re still in unknown territory.

item.title: How a Private-Equity Payday Drained a Hospital Chain of Cash
item.description: Steward Health Care recently went bust, years after paying a $790 million dividend to its shareholders.

item.title: Petco stock surges 33% after Roaring Kitty post
item.description: Shares of Petco Health & Wellness shares rose after it reported second-quarter results and executives on the earnings call discussed a focus on improv...

item.title: Retirees Will Get a Smaller Social Security Raise in 2025---and That's OK
item.description: Next year’s cost-of-living adjustment is expected to be 2.5% as inflation cools.

item.title: Why Fed interest-rate cuts may not be bullish for bitcoin
item.description: A weekly look at the most important news and moves in crypto, and what’s on the horizon in digital assets.

item.title: Topgolf Sent Callaway Into the Rough
item.description: The recreational driving-range business has been a drag for the top golf-equipment maker.

item.title: There’s ’no reason’ for average gamers to buy the 75% more expensive PlayStation 5 Pro, analyst says
item.description: ‘The average gamer will go nowhere near this, there’s no reason for them to,’ one gaming analyst says about the new console
